intro: Tillandsia fasciculata var. bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá tillandsia, is a species of air plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of trichomes, which help in absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air. This plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, humid conditions, often growing on trees or rocks. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in shades of white or pale green. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
